intro: Cynometra marginata var. marginata, commonly known as the African shea tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey-barked trunk and compound leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by oval, woody fruits that contain a fatty seed kernel. The seeds are rich in oil and are widely used in traditional medicine and cosmetics. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
